sentences.english: Pedants sneer at an education which is useful.
sentences.chinese: 迂腐之士譏笑學以致用的教育。

sentences.english: I love you in slow, dim-witted ways.
sentences.chinese: 我愛你，我的方式遲鈍而迂腐。

sentences.english: But here, I'm just being a little more pedantic, that's really what a string is.
sentences.chinese: 但是這裏，我剛有點迂腐的，那實際上就是字符串。

sentences.english: In sum, this "Lei Fong" is sensitive to the extent that he is pedantic and wordy.
sentences.chinese: 總而言之，這“雷鋒”已經細緻到有點迂腐和羅嗦了。

sentences.english: The habit of mind or manner characteristic of a pedant.
sentences.chinese: 迂腐的言行心理或行爲帶有學究氣的習性。

sentences.english: Some may find this agenda too procedural, even a bit dull.
sentences.chinese: 一些人或許認爲，上述議程太過迂腐。

sentences.english: Generation gap, conservation, reminiscence, pedantry and stubbornness all basically derive from that.
sentences.chinese: 代溝，保守，懷舊，迂腐頑固，基本都源於此。
我這裏有點過於迂腐了。

sentences.english: Zhou Jin is a poor and ludicrous character in the Chinese classic novel The Scholars.
sentences.chinese: 周進是《儒林外史》中一個迂腐可憐的人物。

sentences.english: He was a man of forty, thin, with a pinched face, precise and rather pedantic .
sentences.chinese: 他年已四十，瘦骨嶙峋，一張乾瘦的臉，刻板而迂腐。

sentences.english: They tend to be really like nerdy and booky.
sentences.chinese: 他們真的很迂腐，像書呆子。

sentences.english: He had all the illumination of wisdom and none of its pedantry .
sentences.chinese: 他具有智慧的一切光輝，卻沒有絲毫學究的迂腐氣息。

definition: to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom)/to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
